baseline_groups.claim_summary: Asymmetric belief updating (motivated reasoning): subjects in No-Resolution treatment underreact to bad news relative to Bayesian benchmark, indicating motivated beliefs when future uncertainty will not be resolved. The focal coefficient is the slope of belief_adjustment on bayes_belief_adjustment for bad news in the No-Resolution treatment.
baseline_groups.estimand_concept: OLS slope coefficient measuring responsiveness to Bayesian updating benchmark
baseline_groups.target_population: 200 laboratory subjects (university students) in between-subject IQ-test experiment
baseline_groups.expected_sign_notes: The main claim is that the coefficient is near zero (insignificant) for No-Resolution Bad news, demonstrating underreaction. For Good news and Resolution conditions, the coefficient should be positive and significant.
baseline_groups.notes: Six baseline cells from Table 2: 3 columns (Good/Bad/DiD) x 2 treatments (NoRes/Res). The focal cell is baseline (NoRes-Bad): coef=0.076, p=0.674 (insignificant as claimed). All other cells show significant positive slopes except NoRes-Bad, confirming the asymmetric updating pattern.

global_notes: Surface-driven run with 78 estimate rows and 18 inference variants. All rows succeeded. No baseline-group reassignment needed; the surface's G1 is coherent and well-defined.
